description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a7mil","text":"Here is a step by step protocol describing our strategy to label endogenous proteins with split-sfGFP and/or split-wrmScarlet in C. elegans. steps.section: Select a C. elegans strain expressing the split-fluorescent protein1-10 of your choice

steps.section: Select a guide sequence and order a crRNA and tracrRNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a0lgh","text":"Download the DNA sequence of your gene and transcript of interest from Wormbase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":71,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":72,"length":7}],"data":[]},{"key":"4spbd","text":"Identify the desired insertion or knock-in site in the genomic DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"119598D642064C839E54CD3CEE2737DA","url":"https://wormbase.org"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"6A4BCF4B17E04E7E8BC970D27DE8D01A","url":"https://wormbase.org"}}}}

steps.section: Select a guide sequence and order a crRNA and tracrRNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2qi1e","text":"Using ~50 nucleotides flanking Identify DNA sequence(s) followed by a PAM site (5' NGG 3') in your target gene using a CRISPR/Cas9 target online predictor, such as CCTop. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":164,"length":5}],"data":[]},{"key":"ah5vu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1aqfu","text":"When using CCTop, use the default parameters and adjust the following two criteria:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":11,"length":5}],"data":[]},{"key":"8gs56","text":"    PAM type: NGG (Streptococcus pyogenes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3i6fl","text":"    Species: C. elegans","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"85io8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e1v4o","text":"Insert the DNA sequence in the query section, then submit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2ffii","text":"Select the crRNA target site with a high score, the closest to your editing site, with no off- targets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"A18D6DF5A5124A8F8CD096CD2AADA5ED","url":"https://crispr.cos.uni-heidelberg.de/index.html"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"4CC94F9894FF4FD9B05715F0EAEB135B","url":"https://crispr.cos.uni-heidelberg.de/index.html"}}}}

steps.section: Select a guide sequence and order a crRNA and tracrRNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"50j90","text":"Order the crRNA corresponding to your selected guide sequence from IDT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":2},{"key":1,"offset":69,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"3rrc3","text":"Note: Do not include the PAM in the query","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2je9q","text":"Typically, we order 10 nmol of each Alt-R® CRISPR-Cas9 crRNA that we ressuspend in 14.5 μL TE.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"A0624DFDA36648E98971FABB2B46DE65","url":"https://www.idtdna.com/site/order/designtool/index/CRISPR_SEQUENCE"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C5D7CE8064B2429BBEFC29914E74EFF0","url":"https://www.idtdna.com"}}}}

steps.section: Select a guide sequence and order a crRNA and tracrRNA
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"24dmg","text":"Order the universal 67 mer tracrRNA from IDT under the section \"CRISPR-Cas9 tracrRNA\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":3}],"data":[]},{"key":"brb75","text":"https://www.idtdna.com/pages/products/crispr-genome-editing/alt-r-crispr-cas9-system","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":84}],"data":[]},{"key":"e1reu","text":"Typically, we order 20 nmol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"C097326CE81A4C2BB853DDAE79C4925D","url":"https://www.idtdna.com/pages/products/crispr-genome-editing/alt-r-crispr-cas9-system"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8E156745E9D5485489578D4AB8171FD4","url":"https://www.idtdna.com/pages/products/crispr-genome-editing/alt-r-crispr-cas9-system"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8d10q","text":"Design and order oligos that will be used to perform the genotyping and sequencing of the insertion site.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d00cf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"2t32q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d8smc","text":"• 18-24 bases in length","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"14eje","text":"• Melting temperature (Tm) between 50 and 60ºC","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a3o7v","text":"• GC content ranging from 45 to 55%","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"607lp","text":"• G or C on the 3’ end","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"52q27","text":"• Design primers 200 nt upstream and downstream from the sequence of interest","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

mix:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"364k9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehlgo","text":" up and down a few times without introducting air in the mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"480r2","text":"Incubate   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"14tm4","text":"Quick spin   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":11,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b6r7h","text":"Load 0.5 to 1 μL of the mix in injection needles and inject 10 to 20 day-1 adult worms successfully, ideally in both gonad
